intro: Senecio viridifluminis, commonly known as the green-flowered senecio, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, often arranged in dense clusters. Senecio viridifluminis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
